project.teaser: The Growing Up in Digital Europe Preparatory Phase (GUIDEPREP) project further develops the research infrastructure (RI) necessary to implement the GUIDE birth cohort study. This preparatory work will take place across 2022 to 2025 to ready the RI for the full-scale piloting...
project.objective:
The Growing Up in Digital Europe Preparatory Phase (GUIDEPREP) project further develops the research infrastructure (RI) necessary to implement the GUIDE birth cohort study. This preparatory work will take place across 2022 to 2025 to ready the RI for the full-scale piloting of the GUIDE in 2026 and the first full wave of data collection in 2027. Once operational, GUIDE will collect data about individual children growing up in Europe until those children are aged 24-years in approximately 2053.
GUIDE will be Europe’s first comparative birth cohort study of children’s and young people’s wellbeing. The aim of the GUIDE study is to track children’s personal wellbeing and development, in combination with key indicators of children’s homes, neighbourhoods, and schools, across Europe. GUIDE will be an accelerated cohort survey including a sample of infants as well as a sample of school age children. Each Member State and Associated Country will provide nationally representative samples that are designed to retain statistical power throughout the lifetime of the study. The harmonized design will create the first internationally comparable, nationally representative, longitudinal study of children and young people in Europe.
Currently the GUIDE RI is in its preparatory phase, which involves the establishment of necessary operational procedures and further crystallisation of the study concept and design. To realise the GUIDE full-scale pilot in 2026 and first wave of fieldwork in 2027, the RI needs to develop administratively, technologically, financially, scientifically, and legally. This GUIDEPREP proposal lays out clear aims for these developments in an interlocking system of activities that are shared across consortium partners and managed by the GUIDE leadership team.
project.title: Growing Up in Digital Europe Preparation Phase (GUIDEPREP)
project.keywords: GUIDE, European Cohort Study of Children's Wellbeing

result.title: Human Resources Plan 1
result.description: Create a Human Resources Plan for the Central Hub and National Nodes.

result.title: Journal of Psychosomatic Obstetrics and Gynaecology

details.authors: Tia Makela, Terhi Saisto, Katariina Salmela-Aro, and Hanna Rouhe

result.title: Promotional Campaign Plan
result.description: Promotional activity and public relations: social and digital promotional campaign and press campaign supported, with scoping of TV and radio campaign options. Promotional materials to be drafted in English and translated into partner country languages.

result.title: Inception report
result.description: Inception meeting between project coordinators and the Commission

result.title: Data Management Plan GUIDEPREP
result.description: GUIDEPREP will extend on the activities initiated in the COORDINATE project including the development of methods for the secure electronic storing GUIDE working datasets secure transfer of survey data and develop an overarching data management plan for the GUIDE survey data WP2

result.title: Updated Commitments Package
result.description: Indicate the national commitments situation for GUIDE (covering financial commitments, and national roadmap status if relevant) in the form of a brief report (max 4 pages – or delivered orally). Produce two brief reports: one each in Years 2 and 3. For internal use only.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - GUIDEPREP (Growing Up in Digital Europe Preparation Phase (GUIDEPREP))
result.teaser: The Growing Up in Digital Europe Preparatory Phase (GUIDEPREP) project develops the research infrastructure necessary to implement the GUIDE birth cohort study, Europe’s first comparative birth cohort study of children’s and young people’s wellbeing. The aim of the GUIDE...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Ethical application
result.description: A formal ethics submission will be made to UCD for the pilot dress rehearsal and first wave of the GUIDE study updated submissions will be made before each successive wave This will include the questionnaires participant consent assent forms fieldworker protocols and privacy notice MMU UCD

result.title: Risk Management Plan 1
result.description: To create an overarching risk management document for the GUIDE survey, that focuses on specific operational risks for the Central Hub and shared operational risks across the National Nodes.

result.title: Sponsorship Package
result.description: Sponsorship drive. Creation of a sponsorship package for private and non-profit sponsors (e.g., international philanthropists, charities) and drive to recruit sponsors.

result.title: Commitments Package
result.description: Commitments drive. Identification of main funders (e.g., Governments, Research Councils). Schedule of repeated meetings with main funders and GUIDE representatives (National Node and Central Hub). Timeline for funder commitments. Creation of a commitments package for main funders. Secure expressions of commitment in time for the GUIDE full pilot in 2026.

result.title: Sampling and Recruitment Strategy
result.description: Develop GUIDE sampling and recruitment strategy. Establish the criteria for each national sample in collaboration with national partners, with a submission and approval process for national sampling frames. Calculation of projected costs for sample recruitment in approximately ten countries.

result.title: Policy briefs
result.description: GUIDE policy briefs. Production of themed policy briefs using COORDINATE GUIDE pilot data and presentation of results at a thematic workshop.

result.title: GUIDE Questionnaires
result.description: Updated GUIDE questionnaires. Update GUIDE questionnaires based on COORDINATE pilot study, and stakeholder consultations to be arranged in Years 2 and 3 of the project. Establish translation process.

result.title: GUIDE Cognitive Assessments
result.description: Cognitive instruments. Pilot test of cognitive tests for infants, parents, and 8-year-olds, in different modes of data collection.

result.title: Financial Management Plan 1
result.description: Create a financial management plan for the operation of the Central Hub.

result.title: GUIDE Data Management Plan 1
result.description: Create a Data Management Plan for the GUIDE data.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
